## Natural history notes

The Climbing Hempvine (Mikania scandens) is a vine commonly found in wet forests, marshes, and prairies. This vine produces small flowerheads that are highly valuable to wildlife. This is the host plant of the little metalmark (Calephelis virginiensis) butterfly and it is a nector plant for a variety of pollinators. This plant is widely distributed across Florida.
